cards.title: Henderson–Hasselbalch Equation
cards.summary: Relates pH, pKa and the conjugate base/acid ratio for buffers.
cards.details: $pH = pK_a + \log([A^-]/[HA])$. Used to design and analyze buffers and predict pH of solutions containing weak acids and conjugate bases.

cards.title: Gibbs Free Energy
cards.summary: Predicts reaction spontaneity and links to equilibrium.
cards.details: $\Delta G = \Delta H - T\Delta S$ and $\Delta G^\circ = -RT \ln(K_{eq})$. Fundamental for determining if reactions will proceed spontaneously.

cards.title: Electronegativity & Periodic Trends
cards.summary: Trends that determine bonding and reactivity across the periodic table.
cards.details: F > O > N > C. Electronegativity and ionization energy increase left→right; atomic radius decreases left→right. These trends explain chemical behavior.

cards.title: Equilibrium Constant
cards.summary: Relationship of product and reactant concentrations at equilibrium.
cards.details: K_eq = [products]/[reactants]. Relates to ΔG° and determines the position of equilibrium.

cards.title: Atomic Structure & Electron Configuration
cards.summary: Electron configurations and the properties they drive.
cards.details: Aufbau principle and orbital filling. Valence electrons determine reactivity and chemical properties.

cards.title: Acid–Base Chemistry
cards.summary: pH, pKa, buffers and titration essentials for biological systems.
cards.details: $pH = -\log[H^+]$. Buffers consist of weak acid + conjugate base. Titration curves show equivalence point and buffer range.

cards.title: Redox Reactions
cards.summary: Electron transfer processes and their role in metabolism.
cards.details: Oxidation = loss of electrons, Reduction = gain of electrons. Redox couples and standard reduction potentials determine reaction feasibility.

cards.title: Stoichiometry & Limiting Reagents
cards.summary: Quantitative relationships in chemical reactions for yield calculations.
cards.details: Mole ratios from balanced equations. Identify limiting reagent to calculate theoretical yield.

cards.title: Gas Laws
cards.summary: Relationships between pressure, volume, temperature and moles of gas.
cards.details: PV = nRT. Combined gas law for changing conditions. Partial pressures and Dalton's law.

cards.title: Solutions & Concentrations
cards.summary: Calculating molarity, molality and preparing solutions.
cards.details: Molarity = moles/L. Molality = moles/kg solvent. Dilution calculations M1V1 = M2V2.

cards.title: Thermochemistry
cards.summary: Enthalpy, entropy and their role in reaction energetics.
cards.details: ΔH = heat change at constant pressure. ΔS = change in disorder. Exothermic vs endothermic reactions.

cards.title: Functional Groups & Reactivity
cards.summary: Key functional groups and their chemical behavior.
cards.details: Alcohols, amines, carboxylic acids. Nucleophiles vs electrophiles. Reactivity trends determine substitution and elimination outcomes.

cards.title: Stereochemistry
cards.summary: Chirality, enantiomers, diastereomers and their biological implications.
cards.details: Chiral centers and R/S configuration. Enantiomers are mirror images. Stereochemistry is critical for drug activity and enzyme specificity.

cards.title: Reaction Mechanisms
cards.summary: Common organic reaction types and their stepwise mechanisms.
cards.details: SN1 vs SN2 mechanisms. E1 vs E2 eliminations. Addition, elimination, and substitution reactions.

cards.title: Aromaticity & Hückel's Rule
cards.summary: Aromatic compounds and their stability and reactivity.
cards.details: 4n+2 π electrons in aromatic systems. Benzene and aromatic stability. Antiaromatic compounds are destabilized.

cards.title: Protecting Groups
cards.summary: Strategies to mask reactive functional groups during synthesis.
cards.details: Acetals, ethers, and silyl ethers as protecting groups. Key for multi-step syntheses and selective reactions.

cards.title: Carbonyl Chemistry
cards.summary: Aldehydes, ketones, and carboxylic acid derivatives and their reactions.
cards.details: Nucleophilic addition and acyl substitution mechanisms. Aldol condensation and Wittig reactions.

cards.title: Glycolysis
cards.summary: 10-step pathway converting glucose to pyruvate with ATP and NADH generation.
cards.details: 10 enzymes, 2 ATP net, 2 NADH per glucose. Hexokinase & phosphofructokinase are key regulatory steps. Pyruvate fate: TCA, lactate, or gluconeogenesis.

cards.title: Citric Acid Cycle (TCA)
cards.summary: Central metabolic hub oxidizing acetyl-CoA and generating reducing equivalents.
cards.details: 8 enzymes, acetyl-CoA entry point. 3 NADH, 1 $FADH_2$, 1 GTP per cycle. Isocitrate dehydrogenase and $\alpha$-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase are regulatory steps.

cards.title: Michaelis–Menten Kinetics
cards.summary: Enzyme kinetics model linking reaction rate to substrate concentration.
cards.details: $v = \frac{V_{max}[S]}{K_m + [S]}$. $K_m$ relates to enzyme-substrate affinity. $K_m = \frac{k_{-1} + k_2}{k_1}$.

cards.title: Electron Transport Chain & Oxidative Phosphorylation
cards.summary: Electron transfer through complexes I–IV and ATP synthesis.
cards.details: Complexes I–IV pump $H^+$ across inner mitochondrial membrane. ATP synthase uses $\Delta\Psi$ & $\Delta pH$. P/O ratio $\approx$ 2.5 for NADH, $\approx$ 1.5 for $FADH_2$.

cards.title: Metabolic Regulation & Allosteric Control
cards.summary: Feedback inhibition and allosteric enzyme modulation.
cards.details: Allosteric sites remote from active site. Positive vs negative regulators. AMP/ATP ratios signal energy status.

cards.title: Signal Transduction Pathways
cards.summary: Cell communication via receptors, kinase cascades and second messengers.
cards.details: GPCRs & receptor tyrosine kinases. Second messengers (cAMP, Ca²⁺, IP3). MAPK and PI3K pathway signaling.

cards.title: Translation & Protein Synthesis
cards.summary: mRNA → protein: codons, tRNA, ribosome and post-translational modifications.
cards.details: 64 codons: 61 amino acids + 3 stop codons. Initiation at AUG. Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases ensure fidelity. Post-translational modifications.

cards.title: Protein Folding & Chaperones
cards.summary: Thermodynamic and kinetic aspects of protein structure formation.
cards.details: Hydrophobic core and hydrogen bonding drive folding. Chaperone proteins (HSP70, GroEL) prevent aggregation. Misfolding causes diseases.

cards.title: Gene Regulation
cards.summary: Transcriptional and translational control of gene expression.
cards.details: Promoters, enhancers, silencers. Transcription factors and chromatin remodeling. Operons (lac, trp): inducible and repressible regulation.

cards.title: Post-Translational Modifications
cards.summary: Chemical modifications that regulate protein function.
cards.details: Phosphorylation, ubiquitination, glycosylation, and proteolytic cleavage. These modifications control protein activity, localization, and stability.

cards.title: Protein Purification & Analysis
cards.summary: Techniques to isolate and characterize proteins from cells.
cards.details: Cell lysis & chromatin removal. Gel filtration (size exclusion chromatography). Ion exchange and isoelectric focusing.

cards.title: Enzyme Assays & Kinetics
cards.summary: Measuring enzyme activity and determining kinetic parameters.
cards.details: Spectrophotometric assays. Km & Vmax determination from Lineweaver-Burk plots. Inhibition assays (competitive vs non-competitive).

cards.title: SDS-PAGE & Gel Electrophoresis
cards.summary: Separating proteins by size and analyzing protein composition.
cards.details: Denaturing vs native gels. Molecular weight standards for calibration. Staining (Coomassie, silver) and visualization.

cards.title: DNA/RNA Techniques (PCR, qPCR, Sequencing)
cards.summary: Amplifying, quantifying and sequencing nucleic acids.
cards.details: PCR cycles: denaturation, annealing, extension. Real-time qPCR for gene expression. Sanger vs NGS sequencing methods.

cards.title: DNA & RNA Structure
cards.summary: Double helix, base pairing, and structural variations.
cards.details: Watson-Crick base pairing (A-T, G-C). Major and minor grooves. RNA secondary structure and stability.

cards.title: DNA Replication
cards.summary: Semi-conservative replication machinery and fidelity.
cards.details: DNA Pol III holoenzyme (E. coli). Leading vs lagging strands. Priming by primase and Okazaki fragments.

cards.title: Transcription
cards.summary: DNA → RNA: promoters, polymerase, capping and splicing.
cards.details: RNA Pol II in eukaryotes; Pol I/III for rRNA and tRNA. Eukaryotic transcription: 5′ cap, polyadenylation, splicing.

cards.title: Recombinant DNA Technology
cards.summary: Restriction enzymes, cloning and genetic manipulation.
cards.details: Restriction sites create sticky/blunt ends. Plasmid vectors & antibiotic selection. Blue-white screening for recombinants.

cards.title: CRISPR & Genome Editing
cards.summary: Modern gene editing with Cas9 and related endonucleases.
cards.details: gRNA design for target specificity. On-target vs off-target effects. Prime editing and base editing variations.

cards.title: Cell Structure & Function
cards.summary: Organelles, membranes and compartmentalization in eukaryotes.
cards.details: Nucleus, mitochondria, ER, Golgi apparatus. Membrane composition and fluidity. Cell cycle checkpoints.

cards.title: Bioenergetics & Membranes
cards.summary: Energy flow and membrane biology in living systems.
cards.details: ATP as the energy currency of the cell. Proton gradients and chemiosmosis. Lipid bilayer composition and membrane proteins.

cards.title: Photosynthesis
cards.summary: Light and dark reactions converting light energy to chemical energy.
cards.details: Light reactions produce ATP and NADPH. Calvin cycle fixes CO₂. Chloroplast structure and thylakoids.

cards.title: Cell Cycle & Mitosis
cards.summary: Interphase and mitotic division for cell reproduction.
cards.details: G1, S, G2 phases. Mitosis produces two identical diploid cells. Checkpoints control progression.

cards.title: Bacterial Structure & Physiology
cards.summary: Cell wall, pili, flagella, plasmids and metabolic modes.
cards.details: Peptidoglycan and Gram staining. Plasmids enable conjugation. Aerobic vs anaerobic metabolism.

cards.title: Viruses & Replication Cycles
cards.summary: Viral structure, entry, replication and lysis strategies.
cards.details: Capsid and envelope composition. Lytic vs lysogenic cycles. Reverse transcriptase in retroviruses.

cards.title: Antibiotics & Resistance Mechanisms
cards.summary: Mechanisms of action and bacterial resistance strategies.
cards.details: Cell wall synthesis inhibitors (β-lactams). Protein synthesis inhibitors. Enzymatic inactivation, efflux pumps, and target modification.

cards.title: Microbial Genetics & Horizontal Gene Transfer
cards.summary: Gene transfer mechanisms unique to bacteria.
cards.details: Conjugation via pili. Transformation and transduction. Horizontal gene transfer spreads antibiotic resistance.

cards.title: Quantum Chemistry Basics
cards.summary: Schrödinger equation and orbital concepts for molecular structure.
cards.details: Wave functions and probability densities. Atomic and molecular orbitals (HOMO/LUMO). Hybridization: sp, sp², sp³.

cards.title: Advanced Thermodynamics
cards.summary: Phase diagrams, activity coefficients, and chemical potential.
cards.details: Clausius-Clapeyron equation for phase transitions. Activity vs concentration. Gibbs free energy and phase equilibria.

cards.title: Chemical Kinetics & Rate Laws
cards.summary: Reaction mechanisms, rate constants and temperature dependence.
cards.details: Arrhenius equation: k = Ae^(-Ea/RT). Activation energy and transition state theory. Elementary steps and rate-determining step.

cards.title: Classical Mechanics
cards.summary: Motion, forces and conservation laws needed for problem solving.
cards.details: Newton's laws of motion. Conservation of energy and momentum. Rotational dynamics and simple harmonic motion.

cards.title: Waves & Oscillations
cards.summary: Wave behavior and basic modal analysis.
cards.details: Wave equation and v = fλ. Interference and standing waves. Doppler effect.

cards.title: Thermal Physics & Thermodynamics
cards.summary: Laws of thermodynamics, heat transfer and state functions.
cards.details: First and Second Laws of Thermodynamics. Entropy and enthalpy. Isothermal and adiabatic processes.

cards.title: Circuits
cards.summary: Basic circuit analysis and component behavior.
cards.details: Ohm's law: V = IR. Series and parallel circuit rules. Kirchhoff's laws. Capacitors and inductors.

cards.title: Fluids
cards.summary: Fluid statics and dynamics principles for biological contexts.
cards.details: Density ρ = m/V. Pressure P = F/A. Buoyancy and Archimedes' principle. Continuity equation and Bernoulli's principle.

cards.title: Electricity & Magnetism
cards.summary: Electrostatics, circuits and magnetic fields relevant to biophysics.
cards.details: Coulomb's law for electric force. Electric field E = F/q. Magnetic force F = qvB. Biological applications: nerve impulses.

cards.title: Modern Physics
cards.summary: Quantum mechanics and relativity basics for understanding atomic phenomena.
cards.details: Photoelectric effect and energy quantization. Heisenberg uncertainty principle. Special relativity time dilation.

cards.title: Distributions
cards.summary: Choose and interpret probability distributions for experimental data.
cards.details: Normal, binomial, and Poisson distributions. Check assumptions before applying tests. Central Limit Theorem.

cards.title: Descriptive Statistics
cards.summary: Summarize biological data and communicate variability.
cards.details: Mean, median, and standard deviation. SD vs SEM. Report sample size (n) and units; plot individual points.

cards.title: Biological vs Technical Replicates
cards.summary: Designing replicates correctly to separate biological variation from measurement error.
cards.details: Apply statistical tests to biological replicates. Technical replicates assess instrument precision.

cards.title: Hypothesis Testing
cards.summary: Framework to decide if observed differences are likely real.
cards.details: Null hypothesis (H0) vs Alternative (H1). p-value interpretation. α commonly set to 0.05.

cards.title: t-Tests & ANOVA
cards.summary: Comparing means between two or more groups with appropriate assumptions.
cards.details: Unpaired vs paired t-tests. ANOVA for 3+ groups. Post-hoc tests when ANOVA is significant.

cards.title: Regression & Enzyme Kinetics
cards.summary: Curve fitting for calibration and nonlinear kinetics (Michaelis–Menten).
cards.details: Linear regression for calibration curves. Use nonlinear regression for Michaelis-Menten. Report R² and inspect residuals.

cards.title: Error Analysis & Confidence Intervals
cards.summary: Quantify uncertainty and combine errors through calculations.
cards.details: Random vs systematic error. Error propagation through calculations. Report confidence intervals.

cards.title: Sampling & Power Analysis
cards.summary: Plan sample sizes to detect effects reliably.
cards.details: Power analysis for experimental design. Effect size and sample size tradeoffs.

cards.title: Derivatives & Rates of Change
cards.summary: Rates of change and slopes of functions for modeling biological processes.
cards.details: Definition of derivative. Common derivatives (polynomial, exponential, logarithmic). Power, product, and chain rules.

cards.title: Integrals & Accumulation
cards.summary: Area under curves and accumulation functions in biology.
cards.details: Definite vs indefinite integrals. Common integrals. Integration by parts and u-substitution.

cards.title: Differential Equations
cards.summary: Modeling dynamic systems like population growth or enzyme kinetics.
cards.details: First-order separable ODEs. Linear first-order differential equations. Exponential solutions for growth and decay.

cards.title: Multivariable Calculus
cards.summary: Functions of multiple variables and partial derivatives for complex systems.
cards.details: Partial derivatives and mixed partials. Gradient vectors. Multiple integrals for volume and probability.

cards.title: Limits & Continuity
cards.summary: Understanding behavior of functions as inputs approach specific values.
cards.details: Limit definition and evaluation (direct substitution, factoring, rationalizing). Limits at infinity and asymptotic behavior.

cards.title: Acid–Base Titration
cards.summary: Quantitative analysis using endpoint determination.
cards.details: M1V1 = M2V2 dilution formula. Equivalence point vs endpoint. Choice of indicator based on pH range.

cards.title: Spectroscopy (IR, NMR, UV-Vis)
cards.summary: Molecular structure elucidation and quantification.
cards.details: IR for functional group identification. NMR for structure determination (1H, 13C). Beer-Lambert law A = εbc.

cards.title: Solutions & Dilutions
cards.summary: Making and diluting solutions of precise concentration.
cards.details: Molarity, molality, ppm units. Serial dilution practice. Using volumetric glassware correctly.

cards.title: Lab Safety & Data Recording
cards.summary: Essential practices for safe and reproducible work.
cards.details: PPE and chemical handling. MSDS sheets for hazard information. Proper lab notebook documentation and significant figures.

cards.title: Extraction & Purification
cards.summary: Techniques for isolating and purifying organic compounds.
cards.details: Liquid-liquid extraction techniques. Chromatography basics (TLC, column). Recrystallization principles.

cards.title: Synthesis & Retrosynthesis
cards.summary: Planning and executing multi-step organic syntheses.
cards.details: Retrosynthetic analysis for planning. Protecting groups for selective reactions. Common reagents and reaction conditions.

cards.title: Green Chemistry Principles
cards.summary: Sustainable practices in organic synthesis and lab work.
cards.details: Atom economy and waste minimization. Use of safer solvents and reagents. Energy-efficient reactions.

cards.title: Calibration & Standard Curves
cards.summary: Preparing and using standard curves for quantification.
cards.details: Linear regression analysis for curve fitting. Check linearity and goodness of fit (R²). Limits of detection and quantification.

cards.title: Chromatography (HPLC, GC)
cards.summary: Separation techniques for compound analysis.
cards.details: Mobile vs stationary phase selection. Retention time and selectivity optimization. Peak integration and area quantitation.

cards.title: Mass Spectrometry
cards.summary: Ionization, separation and detection of molecular masses.
cards.details: EI vs ESI ionization methods. m/z ratios and isotope patterns. Fragmentation patterns for compound identification.

cards.title: Error Propagation & Detection Limits
cards.summary: Quantifying measurement uncertainty and instrumental limits.
cards.details: LOD = 3σ/slope and LOQ = 10σ/slope. Propagation of uncertainty through calculations.

cards.title: Coordination Compounds & Complexes
cards.summary: Ligand types, coordination geometry and stereoisomerism.
cards.details: Monodentate vs polydentate ligands. Coordination numbers 4 and 6. Geometric and optical isomers.

cards.title: Crystal Field Theory
cards.summary: Splitting of d orbitals and color in transition metal complexes.
cards.details: d-orbital splitting in octahedral and tetrahedral fields. High vs low spin complexes. Color from d-d electronic transitions.

cards.title: Transition Metals & Variable Oxidation States
cards.summary: Properties and reactivity of transition elements.
cards.details: Variable oxidation states and electron configurations. Catalytic activity of transition metals. Colored complexes and magnetism.

cards.title: Organometallics & Catalysis
cards.summary: Metal-carbon bonds and their role in catalysis.
cards.details: Metal-ligand bonding and stability. Common catalytic cycles. Green chemistry applications.

cards.title: BLAST & Sequence Alignment
cards.summary: Finding similar sequences in databases and understanding homology searches.
cards.details: BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool) algorithms. E-values for statistical significance. Sequence identity and similarity scoring.

cards.title: Molecular Databases
cards.summary: Key resources for accessing sequence and structure data.
cards.details: GenBank for DNA sequences. UniProt for protein sequences and annotations. PDB for 3D protein structures.

cards.title: Multiple Sequence Alignment & Phylogenetics
cards.summary: Comparing multiple sequences and inferring evolutionary relationships.
cards.details: MSA algorithms (Clustal, MUSCLE, MAFFT). Phylogenetic trees from evolutionary distances. Building dendrograms.

cards.title: Protein Structure Prediction
cards.summary: Predicting 3D fold from amino acid sequence using computational methods.
cards.details: AlphaFold and deep learning approaches. Secondary structure prediction. Validating predictions with experimental data.

cards.title: Signal Transduction Pathways
cards.summary: Cell communication via receptors, kinase cascades and second messengers.
cards.details: GPCRs & receptor tyrosine kinases. Second messengers (cAMP, Ca²⁺, IP3). MAPK and PI3K pathway signaling.

cards.title: Translation & Protein Synthesis
cards.summary: mRNA → protein: codons, tRNA, ribosome and post-translational modifications.
cards.details: 64 codons: 61 amino acids + 3 stop codons. Initiation at AUG. Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases ensure fidelity. Post-translational modifications.

cards.title: Protein Folding & Chaperones
cards.summary: Thermodynamic and kinetic aspects of protein structure formation.
cards.details: Hydrophobic core and hydrogen bonding drive folding. Chaperone proteins (HSP70, GroEL) prevent aggregation. Misfolding causes diseases.

cards.title: Gene Regulation
cards.summary: Transcriptional and translational control of gene expression.
cards.details: Promoters, enhancers, silencers. Transcription factors and chromatin remodeling. Operons (lac, trp): inducible and repressible regulation.

cards.title: Post-Translational Modifications
cards.summary: Chemical modifications that regulate protein function.
cards.details: Phosphorylation, ubiquitination, glycosylation, and proteolytic cleavage. These modifications control protein activity, localization, and stability.

cards.title: Apoptosis & Programmed Cell Death
cards.summary: Regulated cell death pathways and their biochemical triggers.
cards.details: Caspase cascades and mitochondrial pathways. BcL family proteins. P53 tumor suppressor role in apoptosis.

cards.title: Cell Structure & Function
cards.summary: Organelles, membranes and compartmentalization in eukaryotes.
cards.details: Nucleus, mitochondria, ER, Golgi apparatus. Membrane composition and fluidity. Cell cycle checkpoints.

cards.title: Bioenergetics & Membranes
cards.summary: Energy flow and membrane biology in living systems.
cards.details: ATP as the energy currency of the cell. Proton gradients and chemiosmosis. Lipid bilayer composition and membrane proteins.

cards.title: Photosynthesis
cards.summary: Light and dark reactions converting light energy to chemical energy.
cards.details: Light reactions produce ATP and NADPH. Calvin cycle fixes CO₂. Chloroplast structure and thylakoids.

cards.title: Cell Cycle & Mitosis
cards.summary: Interphase and mitotic division for cell reproduction.
cards.details: G1, S, G2 phases. Mitosis produces two identical diploid cells. Checkpoints control progression.

cards.title: Meiosis & Sexual Reproduction
cards.summary: Reduction division producing haploid gametes.
cards.details: Two meiotic divisions. Homologous chromosome recombination. Crossing over and genetic variation.

cards.title: Bacterial Structure & Physiology
cards.summary: Cell wall, pili, flagella, plasmids and metabolic modes.
cards.details: Peptidoglycan and Gram staining. Plasmids enable conjugation. Aerobic vs anaerobic metabolism.

cards.title: Viruses & Replication Cycles
cards.summary: Viral structure, entry, replication and lysis strategies.
cards.details: Capsid and envelope composition. Lytic vs lysogenic cycles. Reverse transcriptase in retroviruses.

cards.title: Antibiotics & Resistance Mechanisms
cards.summary: Mechanisms of action and bacterial resistance strategies.
cards.details: Cell wall synthesis inhibitors (β-lactams). Protein synthesis inhibitors. Enzymatic inactivation, efflux pumps, and target modification.

cards.title: Microbial Genetics & Horizontal Gene Transfer
cards.summary: Gene transfer mechanisms unique to bacteria.
cards.details: Conjugation via pili. Transformation and transduction. Horizontal gene transfer spreads antibiotic resistance.

cards.title: Fermentation & Anaerobic Metabolism
cards.summary: Energy production without oxygen.
cards.details: Lactate fermentation. Alcohol fermentation. Energetics and products of fermentation pathways.

cards.title: DNA & RNA Structure
cards.summary: Double helix, base pairing, and structural variations.
cards.details: Watson-Crick base pairing (A-T, G-C). Major and minor grooves. RNA secondary structure and stability.

cards.title: DNA Replication
cards.summary: Semi-conservative replication machinery and fidelity.
cards.details: DNA Pol III holoenzyme (E. coli). Leading vs lagging strands. Priming by primase and Okazaki fragments.

cards.title: Transcription
cards.summary: DNA → RNA: promoters, polymerase, capping and splicing.
cards.details: RNA Pol II in eukaryotes; Pol I/III for rRNA and tRNA. Eukaryotic transcription: 5′ cap, polyadenylation, splicing.

cards.title: Recombinant DNA Technology
cards.summary: Restriction enzymes, cloning and genetic manipulation.
cards.details: Restriction sites create sticky/blunt ends. Plasmid vectors & antibiotic selection. Blue-white screening for recombinants.

cards.title: CRISPR & Genome Editing
cards.summary: Modern gene editing with Cas9 and related endonucleases.
cards.details: gRNA design for target specificity. On-target vs off-target effects. Prime editing and base editing variations.

cards.title: RNA Splicing & Alternative Processing
cards.summary: Post-transcriptional splicing and alternative transcript variants.
cards.details: Splice sites and recognition sequences. Snurps and the spliceosome. Alternative splicing for protein diversity.

cards.title: BLAST & Sequence Alignment
cards.summary: Finding similar sequences in databases and understanding homology searches.
cards.details: BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool) algorithms. E-values for statistical significance. Sequence identity and similarity scoring.

cards.title: Molecular Databases
cards.summary: Key resources for accessing sequence and structure data.
cards.details: GenBank for DNA sequences. UniProt for protein sequences and annotations. PDB for 3D protein structures.

cards.title: Multiple Sequence Alignment & Phylogenetics
cards.summary: Comparing multiple sequences and inferring evolutionary relationships.
cards.details: MSA algorithms (Clustal, MUSCLE, MAFFT). Phylogenetic trees from evolutionary distances. Building dendrograms.

cards.title: Protein Structure Prediction
cards.summary: Predicting 3D fold from amino acid sequence using computational methods.
cards.details: AlphaFold and deep learning approaches. Secondary structure prediction. Validating predictions with experimental data.

cards.title: Hidden Markov Models & Motifs
cards.summary: Pattern recognition in biological sequences.
cards.details: HMM principles for sequence modeling. PFAM and domain identification. Motif databases and searches.

cards.title: Variant Calling & Annotation
cards.summary: Identifying and interpreting genetic variants.
cards.details: SNP detection from sequencing data. Functional annotation. Disease association and classification.

cards.title: DNA Structure & Replication
cards.summary: DNA double helix and semi-conservative replication mechanisms.
cards.details: Watson-Crick base pairing (A-T, G-C). DNA polymerases and replication fork machinery. Priming and Okazaki fragments.

cards.title: Transcription & Translation
cards.summary: From DNA to mRNA to protein: the central dogma of molecular biology.
cards.details: RNA polymerase and transcription factor action. Genetic code: 61 codons for amino acids plus 3 stop codons. Translation machinery.

cards.title: Molecular Techniques (PCR, Sequencing, Cloning)
cards.summary: Essential lab methods for manipulating and analyzing DNA.
cards.details: PCR: denaturation, annealing, extension cycles. Sanger and NGS sequencing methods. Cloning vectors and transformation.

cards.title: Epigenetics
cards.summary: Heritable changes in gene expression without DNA sequence changes.
cards.details: DNA methylation and histone modifications. Chromatin remodeling and gene silencing. Environmental effects on epigenome.

cards.title: Mendelian Genetics & Inheritance Patterns
cards.summary: Classical genetic principles and trait inheritance.
cards.details: Dominant and recessive alleles. Punnett squares and dihybrid crosses. Linkage and genetic mapping.

cards.title: Population Genetics & Evolution
cards.summary: Allele frequencies and evolutionary forces.
cards.details: Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium. Selection, mutation, migration and genetic drift. Evolution at molecular level.

cards.title: Quick Start Guide
cards.summary: Get started with interactive biochemistry tools.
cards.details: Explore the 3D molecular viewer, access practice problems, and navigate learning resources by topic.

cards.title: Year 1 — Foundations
cards.summary: Essential foundational courses for biochemistry majors.
cards.details: General Chemistry, Calculus, Introductory Biology, and laboratory safety protocols. Build mathematical and chemical fundamentals.

cards.title: Year 2 — Core Chemical Principles
cards.summary: Advanced chemistry and analytical methods.
cards.details: Organic Chemistry, Physical Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry. Develop problem-solving and lab technique skills.

cards.title: Year 3 — Biochemistry & Techniques
cards.summary: Biochemistry fundamentals and laboratory practice.
cards.details: Biochemistry I & II, enzyme kinetics, molecular biology lab. Learn bioinformatics and analytical techniques.

cards.title: Year 4 — Synthesis & Capstone
cards.summary: Advanced topics and independent research.
cards.details: Electives in structural biology, bioinformatics, or drug design. Capstone project or internship experience.

cards.title: Glucose Molecule
cards.summary: Explore the structure of glucose ($C_6H_{12}O_6$), a key monosaccharide.
cards.details: View 3D atomic structure, bond angles, and functional groups. Understand glucose as the substrate for glycolysis.

cards.title: ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate)
cards.summary: The energy currency of the cell in 3D.
cards.details: Visualize adenine base, ribose sugar, and high-energy phosphate bonds. ATP hydrolysis: $ATP + H_2O \rightarrow ADP + P_i$ releases energy.

cards.title: Saved Views & Perspectives
cards.summary: Store and retrieve favorite molecular views.
cards.details: Save camera positions and zoom levels. Access preset views for common molecules across the curriculum.

cards.title: Glycolysis — Map & Key Enzymes
cards.summary: Step-by-step map of glycolysis highlighting regulatory enzymes and flux points.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Glycolysis (10 steps)} \\[6pt] 1.\;& \mathrm{Glucose} \rightarrow \mathrm{G6P} \quad (\text{Hexokinase / Glucokinase}) \\ 2.\;& \mathrm{G6P} \leftrightarrow \mathrm{F6P} \\ 3.\;& \mathrm{F6P} \rightarrow \mathrm{F1,6BP} \quad (\text{PFK-1; rate-limiting, ATP used}) \\ 4.\;& \mathrm{F1,6BP} \rightarrow \mathrm{DHAP} + \mathrm{G3P} \\ 5.\;& \mathrm{DHAP} \leftrightarrow \mathrm{G3P} \\ 6.\;& \mathrm{G3P} \rightarrow 1,3\text{-}\mathrm{BPG} \quad (\text{GAPDH; } \mathrm{NAD^+ \rightarrow NADH}) \\ 7.\;& 1,3\text{-}\mathrm{BPG} \rightarrow 3\text{-}\mathrm{PG} \quad (\text{PGK; ATP formed}) \\ 8.\;& 3\text{-}\mathrm{PG} \rightarrow 2\text{-}\mathrm{PG} \\ 9.\;& 2\text{-}\mathrm{PG} \rightarrow \mathrm{PEP} \\ 10.\;& \mathrm{PEP} \rightarrow \mathrm{Pyruvate} \quad (\text{Pyruvate kinase; ATP formed}) \\[6pt] \textbf{Net:}\;& \mathbf{2\ ATP},\; 2\ \mathrm{NADH},\; 2\ \mathrm{Pyruvate} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: TCA / Citric Acid Cycle
cards.summary: Complete TCA cycle map with inputs, outputs and regulation nodes.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{TCA / Citric Acid Cycle (per acetyl-CoA)} \\[6pt] & \mathrm{Entry:\ Pyruvate \rightarrow Acetyl{-}CoA\ (PDH;\ CO_2\ released;\ NAD^+ \rightarrow NADH)} \\ 1.\;& \mathrm{Acetyl{-}CoA + OAA \rightarrow Citrate\ (Citrate\ synthase)} \\ 2.\;& \mathrm{Citrate \leftrightarrow Isocitrate\ (Aconitase)} \\ 3.\;& \mathrm{Isocitrate \rightarrow \alpha{-}KG\ (Isocitrate\ dehydrogenase;\ NAD^+ \rightarrow NADH;\ CO_2)} \\ 4.\;& \mathrm{\alpha{-}KG \rightarrow Succinyl{-}CoA\ (\alpha{-}KGDH;\ NAD^+ \rightarrow NADH;\ CO_2)} \\ 5.\;& \mathrm{Succinyl{-}CoA \rightarrow Succinate\ (Succinyl{-}CoA\ synthetase;\ GTP)} \\ 6.\;& \mathrm{Succinate \rightarrow Fumarate\ (Succinate\ dehydrogenase;\ FAD \rightarrow FADH_2)} \\ 7.\;& \mathrm{Fumarate \rightarrow Malate\ (Fumarase)} \\ 8.\;& \mathrm{Malate \rightarrow OAA\ (Malate\ dehydrogenase;\ NAD^+ \rightarrow NADH)} \\[6pt] \text{Per turn: }& \;3\ \mathrm{NADH},\;1\ \mathrm{FADH_2},\;1\ \mathrm{GTP} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Electron Transport & Oxidative Phosphorylation
cards.summary: Complexes I–IV, proton pumping and ATP synthase coupling.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{ETC \& OxPhos — key steps} \\[6pt] & \mathrm{Complex\ I:\ NADH \rightarrow NAD^+;\ electrons \rightarrow CoQ;\ pumps\ protons} \\ & \mathrm{Complex\ II:\ Succinate \rightarrow Fumarate;\ FADH_2 \rightarrow CoQ;\ (no\ proton\ pumping)} \\ & \mathrm{CoQ\ shuttles\ electrons\ to\ Complex\ III} \\ & \mathrm{Complex\ III:\ transfers\ to\ Cytochrome\ c;\ pumps\ protons} \\ & \mathrm{Cytochrome\ c:\ mobile\ electron\ carrier} \\ & \mathrm{Complex\ IV:\ O_2 \rightarrow H_2O;\ pumps\ protons\ (terminal\ acceptor)} \\ & \mathrm{ATP\ synthase:\ proton\ return \rightarrow ADP + Pi \rightarrow ATP} \\[6pt] \text{Note: proton motive force }(\Delta\Psi + \Delta pH) ;\ \text{ROS formed as side-reactions.} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Pentose Phosphate Pathway (PPP)
cards.summary: NADPH & ribose-5-phosphate production and oxidative/non-oxidative branches.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{PPP — key branches} \\[6pt] & \text{Oxidative: }\;\mathrm{G6P \rightarrow 6{-}phosphogluconate \rightarrow Ribulose{-}5{-}P\ (G6PD;\ produces\ NADPH)} \\ & \text{Non-oxidative: transketolase / transaldolase interconversions; supplies ribose-5-P or returns carbons to glycolysis} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Urea Cycle & Nitrogen Disposal
cards.summary: Ammonia detoxification and urea synthesis pathway.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Urea Cycle (hepatic)} \\[6pt] 1.\;& \mathrm{NH_4^+ + HCO_3^- \rightarrow Carbamoyl\ phosphate\ (CPS\text{ I};\ ATP)} \\ 2.\;& \mathrm{Carbamoyl\ phosphate + Ornithine \rightarrow Citrulline\ (OTC)} \\ 3.\;& \mathrm{Citrulline + Aspartate \rightarrow Argininosuccinate\ (Argininosuccinate\ synthetase;\ ATP)} \\ 4.\;& \mathrm{Argininosuccinate \rightarrow Arginine + Fumarate\ (links\ to\ TCA)} \\ 5.\;& \mathrm{Arginine \rightarrow Ornithine + Urea\ (Arginase)} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Fatty Acid β-Oxidation
cards.summary: Stepwise shortening of fatty acids to acetyl-CoA with FAD/NAD+ reduction.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Fatty Acid \beta\text{-}Oxidation (overview)} \\[6pt] 1.\;& \text{Activation: }\mathrm{FA + CoA \rightarrow Acyl\text{-}CoA} \\ & \quad (\text{Acyl\text{-}CoA synthetase; ATP} \rightarrow \text{AMP}) \\ 2.\;& \text{Transport: Carnitine shuttle (CPT1/CPT2); CPT1 inhibited by malonyl\text{-}CoA} \\ 3.\;& \text{Cycle (per 2C removed):} \\ & \text{Dehydrogenation (FAD} \rightarrow \text{FADH}_2) \\ & \rightarrow \text{Hydration} \\ & \rightarrow \text{Dehydrogenation (NAD}^+ \rightarrow \text{NADH)} \\ & \rightarrow \text{Thiolysis (acetyl\text{-}CoA released)} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Fatty Acid Synthesis & Lipogenesis
cards.summary: Fatty-acid chain assembly from acetyl-CoA using NADPH.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Fatty Acid Synthesis (cytosol)} \\[6pt] & \text{Citrate shuttle: citrate exported to cytosol \rightarrow ATP{-}citrate lyase \rightarrow acetyl{-}CoA} \\ & \text{Commitment: acetyl{-}CoA \rightarrow malonyl{-}CoA (ACC; rate-limiting; regulated)} \\ & \text{Elongation: Fatty Acid Synthase catalyzes iterative 2-C additions; NADPH consumed (PPP, malic enzyme sources)} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Gluconeogenesis & Regulation
cards.summary: Pathway for glucose synthesis and control points opposing glycolysis.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Gluconeogenesis — bypasses of glycolysis} \\[6pt] & \mathrm{Pyruvate \rightarrow Oxaloacetate\ (Pyruvate\ carboxylase;\ ATP;\ mitochondrial;\ activated\ by\ acetyl{-}CoA)} \\ & \mathrm{Oxaloacetate \rightarrow PEP\ (PEPCK;\ GTP)} \\ & \mathrm{Fructose{-}1,6{-}BP \rightarrow Fructose{-}6{-}P\ (FBPase)} \\ & \mathrm{Glucose{-}6{-}P \rightarrow Glucose\ (Glucose{-}6{-}phosphatase;\ liver/kidney)} \\[6pt] \text{Energetic cost: }& \approx 6\;\text{ATP equivalents per glucose} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Amino Acid Catabolism & Transaminations
cards.summary: Major routes for amino-acid breakdown and nitrogen shuttling.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Amino Acid Catabolism — key reactions} \\[6pt] & \text{Transamination: }\;\mathrm{AA + \alpha{-}KG \rightleftharpoons \alpha{-}ketoacid + Glutamate\ (Aminotransferases; e.g., ALT/AST)} \\ & \text{Oxidative deamination: }\;\mathrm{Glutamate \rightarrow \alpha{-}KG + NH_4^+\ (Glutamate\ dehydrogenase)} \\ & \text{Carbon skeletons funnel into TCA at multiple entry points (pyruvate, Acetyl{-}CoA, \alpha{-}KG, succinyl{-}CoA, fumarate, OAA)} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Integrated Metabolic Maps (Interactive)
cards.summary: Clickable maps showing cross-talk between pathways and compartmentalization.
cards.details: \[\begin{aligned}\textbf{Integrated Map — display recommendations} \\[6pt] & \text{Show compartments: cytosol vs mitochondrion; indicate citrate/malate shuttles} \\ & \text{Mark branch points: G6P (PPP), Citrate (FA synthesis), Pyruvate (TCA/alanine/lactate)} \\ & \text{Label transporters: GLUT, MPC (mitochondrial pyruvate carrier), CPT1/CPT2} \end{aligned}\]

cards.title: Chemical & Physical Foundations (MCAT)
cards.summary: High-yield chemistry & physics concepts tested on the MCAT.
cards.details: Atomic structure, stoichiometry, gas laws, acid–base, basic circuit & optics concepts. Focused review and quick reference sheets mapped to AAMC topics.

cards.title: Biological & Biochemical Foundations (MCAT)
cards.summary: High-yield biology/biochemistry topics and conceptual linkages.
cards.details: Cellular processes, metabolism (glycolysis, TCA, ETC), enzymes, DNA/RNA basics, and lab reasoning. Includes practice passages tied to these topics.

cards.title: Psychology & Sociology Foundations
cards.summary: Core psych/soc concepts and frameworks used on the MCAT.
cards.details: Basic cognition, behavior, social structure, identity, biases, and experimental design relevant to passage analysis and interpretation.

cards.title: CARS — Comprehension & Strategy
cards.summary: Approach and timing strategies for Critical Analysis & Reasoning Skills.
cards.details: Active reading strategies, passage mapping, question triage, and timed practice drills. Tips for inference and evidence-based reasoning.

cards.title: Practice Passages & Explanations
cards.summary: Curated MCAT-style passages with stepwise explanations and timing controls.
cards.details: Passages mapped to topic tags, full answer walkthroughs, reasoning templates, and common distractors. Benchmarked for AAMC difficulty levels.

cards.title: Full-Length Exam Simulations
cards.summary: Timed, proctored full-length practice tests to mirror test day pacing.
cards.details: Section timing, break scheduling, performance analytics, and cumulative score estimates. Recommendations for review after each simulation.

cards.title: High-Yield Facts & Cheat Sheets
cards.summary: One-page summaries of must-know facts for quick review and Anki export.
cards.details: Concise facts for metabolism, membrane transport, acid/base, enzyme kinetics, and signaling. Includes suggested Anki cloze cards and mnemonics.

cards.title: Timing, Breaks & Test-Day Logistics
cards.summary: Practical advice on pacing, stamina, and test-day checklist.
cards.details: Recommended pacing per section, nutrition and sleep tips, what to bring, and stress management techniques for optimal performance.
